 644        self, constraints: Optional[_IndexOrSeries] = None
 645    ) -> _IndexOrSeries:
 646        if constraints is None:
 647            return self.get_linear_constraints()

 651    def _get_variables(self, variables: Optional[pd.Index]) -> pd.Index:

 665    def get_linear_constraints(self) -> pd.Index:
 666        """Gets all linear constraints in the model."""
 667        return pd.Index(
 668            [self.linear_constraint_from_index(i) for i in range(self.num_constraints)],
 669            name="linear_constraint",
 670        )
 671
 672    def get_linear_constraint_expressions(
 673        self, constraints: Optional[_IndexOrSeries] = None
 674    ) -> pd.Series:
 675        """Gets the expressions of all linear constraints in the set.
 676
 677        If `constraints` is a `pd.Index`, then the output will be indexed by the
 678        constraints. If `constraints` is a `pd.Series` indexed by the underlying
 679        dimensions, then the output will be indexed by the same underlying
 680        dimensions.
 681
 682        Args:
 683          constraints (Union[pd.Index, pd.Series]): Optional. The set of linear
 684            constraints from which to get the expressions. If unspecified, all
 685            linear constraints will be in scope.
 686
 687        Returns:
 688          pd.Series: The expressions of all linear constraints in the set.
 689        """
 690        return _attribute_series(
 691            # pylint: disable=g-long-lambda
 692            func=lambda c: _as_flat_linear_expression(
 693                # pylint: disable=g-complex-comprehension
 694                sum(
 695                    coeff * Variable(self.__helper, var_id, None, None, None)
 696                    for var_id, coeff in zip(
 697                        c.helper.constraint_var_indices(c.index),
 698                        c.helper.constraint_coefficients(c.index),
 699                    )
 700                )
 701            ),
 702            values=self._get_linear_constraints(constraints),
 703        )
 704
 705    def get_linear_constraint_lower_bounds(
 706        self, constraints: Optional[_IndexOrSeries] = None
 707    ) -> pd.Series:
 708        """Gets the lower bounds of all linear constraints in the set.
 709
 710        If `constraints` is a `pd.Index`, then the output will be indexed by the
 711        constraints. If `constraints` is a `pd.Series` indexed by the underlying
 712        dimensions, then the output will be indexed by the same underlying
 713        dimensions.
 714
 715        Args:
 716          constraints (Union[pd.Index, pd.Series]): Optional. The set of linear
 717            constraints from which to get the lower bounds. If unspecified, all
 718            linear constraints will be in scope.
 719
 720        Returns:
 721          pd.Series: The lower bounds of all linear constraints in the set.
 722        """
 723        return _attribute_series(
 724            func=lambda c: c.lower_bound,  # pylint: disable=protected-access
 725            values=self._get_linear_constraints(constraints),
 726        )
 727

 859    def new_var_series(
 860        self,
 861        name: str,
 862        index: pd.Index,
 863        lower_bounds: Union[NumberT, pd.Series] = -math.inf,
 864        upper_bounds: Union[NumberT, pd.Series] = math.inf,
 865        is_integral: Union[bool, pd.Series] = False,
 866    ) -> pd.Series:
 867        """Creates a series of (scalar-valued) variables with the given name.
 868
 869        Args:
 870          name (str): Required. The name of the variable set.
 871          index (pd.Index): Required. The index to use for the variable set.
 872          lower_bounds (Union[int, float, pd.Series]): Optional. A lower bound for
 873            variables in the set. If a `pd.Series` is passed in, it will be based on
 874            the corresponding values of the pd.Series. Defaults to -inf.
 875          upper_bounds (Union[int, float, pd.Series]): Optional. An upper bound for
 876            variables in the set. If a `pd.Series` is passed in, it will be based on
 877            the corresponding values of the pd.Series. Defaults to +inf.
 878          is_integral (bool, pd.Series): Optional. Indicates if the variable can
 879            only take integer values. If a `pd.Series` is passed in, it will be
 880            based on the corresponding values of the pd.Series. Defaults to False.
 881
 882        Returns:
 883          pd.Series: The variable set indexed by its corresponding dimensions.
 884
 885        Raises:
 886          TypeError: if the `index` is invalid (e.g. a `DataFrame`).
 887          ValueError: if the `name` is not a valid identifier or already exists.
 888          ValueError: if the `lowerbound` is greater than the `upperbound`.
 889          ValueError: if the index of `lower_bound`, `upper_bound`, or `is_integer`
 890          does not match the input index.
 891        """
 892        if not isinstance(index, pd.Index):
 893            raise TypeError("Non-index object is used as index")
 894        if not name.isidentifier():
 895            raise ValueError("name={} is not a valid identifier".format(name))
 896        if (
 897            mbn.is_a_number(lower_bounds)
 898            and mbn.is_a_number(upper_bounds)
 899            and lower_bounds > upper_bounds
 900        ):
 901            raise ValueError(
 902                "lower_bound={} is greater than upper_bound={} for variable set={}".format(
 903                    lower_bounds, upper_bounds, name
 904                )
 905            )
 906        if (
 907            isinstance(is_integral, bool)
 908            and is_integral
 909            and mbn.is_a_number(lower_bounds)
 910            and mbn.is_a_number(upper_bounds)
 911            and math.isfinite(lower_bounds)
 912            and math.isfinite(upper_bounds)
 913            and math.ceil(lower_bounds) > math.floor(upper_bounds)
 914        ):
 915            raise ValueError(
 916                "ceil(lower_bound={})={}".format(lower_bounds, math.ceil(lower_bounds))
 917                + " is greater than floor("
 918                + "upper_bound={})={}".format(upper_bounds, math.floor(upper_bounds))
 919                + " for variable set={}".format(name)
 920            )
 921        lower_bounds = _convert_to_series_and_validate_index(lower_bounds, index)
 922        upper_bounds = _convert_to_series_and_validate_index(upper_bounds, index)
 923        is_integrals = _convert_to_series_and_validate_index(is_integral, index)
 924        return pd.Series(
 925            index=index,
 926            data=[
 927                # pylint: disable=g-complex-comprehension
 928                Variable(
 929                    helper=self.__helper,
 930                    name=f"{name}[{i}]",
 931                    lb=lower_bounds[i],
 932                    ub=upper_bounds[i],
 933                    is_integral=is_integrals[i],
 934                )
 935                for i in index
 936            ],
 937        )
 938
 939    def new_num_var_series(
 940        self,
 941        name: str,
 942        index: pd.Index,
 943        lower_bounds: Union[NumberT, pd.Series] = -math.inf,
 944        upper_bounds: Union[NumberT, pd.Series] = math.inf,
 945    ) -> pd.Series:
 946        """Creates a series of continuous variables with the given name.
 947
 948        Args:
 949          name (str): Required. The name of the variable set.
 950          index (pd.Index): Required. The index to use for the variable set.
 951          lower_bounds (Union[int, float, pd.Series]): Optional. A lower bound for
 952            variables in the set. If a `pd.Series` is passed in, it will be based on
 953            the corresponding values of the pd.Series. Defaults to -inf.
 954          upper_bounds (Union[int, float, pd.Series]): Optional. An upper bound for
 955            variables in the set. If a `pd.Series` is passed in, it will be based on
 956            the corresponding values of the pd.Series. Defaults to +inf.
 957
 958        Returns:
 959          pd.Series: The variable set indexed by its corresponding dimensions.
 960
 961        Raises:
 962          TypeError: if the `index` is invalid (e.g. a `DataFrame`).
 963          ValueError: if the `name` is not a valid identifier or already exists.
 964          ValueError: if the `lowerbound` is greater than the `upperbound`.
 965          ValueError: if the index of `lower_bound`, `upper_bound`, or `is_integer`
 966          does not match the input index.
 967        """

1032    @property
1033    def num_variables(self) -> int:
1034        """Returns the number of variables in the model."""

1036
1037    # Linear constraints.
1038
1039    def add_linear_constraint(  # pytype: disable=annotation-type-mismatch  # numpy-scalars
1040        self,
1041        linear_expr: LinearExprT,
1042        lb: NumberT = -math.inf,
1043        ub: NumberT = math.inf,
1044        name: Optional[str] = None,
1045    ) -> LinearConstraint:
1046        """Adds the constraint: `lb <= linear_expr <= ub` with the given name."""
1047        ct = LinearConstraint(self.__helper)
1048        if name:
1049            self.__helper.set_constraint_name(ct.index, name)
1050        if mbn.is_a_number(linear_expr):
1051            self.__helper.set_constraint_lower_bound(ct.index, lb - linear_expr)
1052            self.__helper.set_constraint_upper_bound(ct.index, ub - linear_expr)
1053        elif isinstance(linear_expr, Variable):
1054            self.__helper.set_constraint_lower_bound(ct.index, lb)
1055            self.__helper.set_constraint_upper_bound(ct.index, ub)
1056            self.__helper.add_term_to_constraint(ct.index, linear_expr.index, 1.0)
1057        elif isinstance(linear_expr, LinearExpr):
1058            flat_expr = _as_flat_linear_expression(linear_expr)
1059            # pylint: disable=protected-access
1060            self.__helper.set_constraint_lower_bound(ct.index, lb - flat_expr._offset)
1061            self.__helper.set_constraint_upper_bound(ct.index, ub - flat_expr._offset)
1062            self.__helper.add_terms_to_constraint(
1063                ct.index, flat_expr._variable_indices, flat_expr._coefficients
1064            )
1065        else:
1066            raise TypeError(
1067                f"Not supported: ModelBuilder.add_linear_constraint({linear_expr})"
1068                f" with type {type(linear_expr)}"
1069            )
1070        return ct
1071
1072    def add(
1073        self, ct: Union[ConstraintT, pd.Series], name: Optional[str] = None
1074    ) -> Union[LinearConstraint, pd.Series]:
1075        """Adds a `BoundedLinearExpression` to the model.
1076
1077        Args:
1078          ct: A [`BoundedLinearExpression`](#boundedlinearexpression).
1079          name: An optional name.
1080
1081        Returns:
1082          An instance of the `Constraint` class.
1083
1084        Note that a special treatment is done when the argument does not contain any
1085        variable, and thus evaluates to True or False.
1086
1087        model.add(True) will create a constraint 0 <= empty sum <= 0
1088
1089        model.add(False) will create a constraint inf <= empty sum <= -inf
1090
1091        you can check the if a constraint is always false (lb=inf, ub=-inf) by
1092        calling LinearConstraint.is_always_false()
1093        """
1094        if isinstance(ct, _BoundedLinearExpr):
1095            return ct._add_linear_constraint(self.__helper, name)
1096        elif isinstance(ct, bool):
1097            return _add_linear_constraint_to_helper(ct, self.__helper, name)
1098        elif isinstance(ct, pd.Series):
1099            return pd.Series(
1100                index=ct.index,
1101                data=[
1102                    _add_linear_constraint_to_helper(
1103                        expr, self.__helper, f"{name}[{i}]"
1104                    )
1105                    for (i, expr) in zip(ct.index, ct)
1106                ],
1107            )
1108        else:
1109            raise TypeError("Not supported: ModelBuilder.Add(" + str(ct) + ")")
1110
1111    @property
1112    def num_constraints(self) -> int:
1113        return self.__helper.num_constraints()
1114
1115    # Objective.
1116    def minimize(self, linear_expr: LinearExprT) -> None:
1117        self.__optimize(linear_expr, False)
1118
1119    def maximize(self, linear_expr: LinearExprT) -> None:
1120        self.__optimize(linear_expr, True)
1121
1122    def __optimize(self, linear_expr: LinearExprT, maximize: bool) -> None:
1123        """Defines the objective."""
1124        self.helper.clear_objective()
1125        self.__helper.set_maximize(maximize)
1126        if mbn.is_a_number(linear_expr):
1127            self.helper.set_objective_offset(linear_expr)
1128        elif isinstance(linear_expr, Variable):
1129            self.helper.set_var_objective_coefficient(linear_expr.index, 1.0)
1130        elif isinstance(linear_expr, LinearExpr):
1131            flat_expr = _as_flat_linear_expression(linear_expr)
1132            # pylint: disable=protected-access
1133            self.helper.set_objective_offset(flat_expr._offset)
1134            self.helper.set_objective_coefficients(
1135                flat_expr._variable_indices, flat_expr._coefficients
1136            )
1137        else:
1138            raise TypeError(
1139                f"Not supported: ModelBuilder.minimize/maximize({linear_expr})"
1140            )
1141
1142    @property
1143    def objective_offset(self) -> np.double:
1144        return self.__helper.objective_offset()
1145
1146    @objective_offset.setter
1147    def objective_offset(self, value: NumberT) -> None:
1148        self.__helper.set_objective_offset(value)
1149
1150    def objective_expression(self) -> "_LinearExpression":
1151        return _as_flat_linear_expression(
1152            sum(
1153                variable * self.__helper.var_objective_coefficient(variable.index)
1154                for variable in self.get_variables()
1155                if self.__helper.var_objective_coefficient(variable.index) != 0.0
1156            )
1157            + self.__helper.objective_offset()
1158        )

def new_var_series( self, name: str, index: pandas.core.indexes.base.Index, lower_bounds: Union[int, float, numbers.Real, numpy.number, pandas.core.series.Series] = -inf, upper_bounds: Union[int, float, numbers.Real, numpy.number, pandas.core.series.Series] = inf, is_integral: Union[bool, pandas.core.series.Series] = False) -> pandas.core.series.Series: 
859    def new_var_series(
860        self,
861        name: str,
862        index: pd.Index,
863        lower_bounds: Union[NumberT, pd.Series] = -math.inf,
864        upper_bounds: Union[NumberT, pd.Series] = math.inf,
865        is_integral: Union[bool, pd.Series] = False,
866    ) -> pd.Series:
867        """Creates a series of (scalar-valued) variables with the given name.
868
869        Args:
870          name (str): Required. The name of the variable set.
871          index (pd.Index): Required. The index to use for the variable set.
872          lower_bounds (Union[int, float, pd.Series]): Optional. A lower bound for
873            variables in the set. If a `pd.Series` is passed in, it will be based on
874            the corresponding values of the pd.Series. Defaults to -inf.
875          upper_bounds (Union[int, float, pd.Series]): Optional. An upper bound for
876            variables in the set. If a `pd.Series` is passed in, it will be based on
877            the corresponding values of the pd.Series. Defaults to +inf.
878          is_integral (bool, pd.Series): Optional. Indicates if the variable can
879            only take integer values. If a `pd.Series` is passed in, it will be
880            based on the corresponding values of the pd.Series. Defaults to False.
881
882        Returns:
883          pd.Series: The variable set indexed by its corresponding dimensions.
884
885        Raises:
886          TypeError: if the `index` is invalid (e.g. a `DataFrame`).
887          ValueError: if the `name` is not a valid identifier or already exists.
888          ValueError: if the `lowerbound` is greater than the `upperbound`.
889          ValueError: if the index of `lower_bound`, `upper_bound`, or `is_integer`
890          does not match the input index.
891        """
892        if not isinstance(index, pd.Index):
893            raise TypeError("Non-index object is used as index")
894        if not name.isidentifier():
895            raise ValueError("name={} is not a valid identifier".format(name))
896        if (
897            mbn.is_a_number(lower_bounds)
898            and mbn.is_a_number(upper_bounds)
899            and lower_bounds > upper_bounds
900        ):
901            raise ValueError(
902                "lower_bound={} is greater than upper_bound={} for variable set={}".format(
903                    lower_bounds, upper_bounds, name
904                )
905            )
906        if (
907            isinstance(is_integral, bool)
908            and is_integral
909            and mbn.is_a_number(lower_bounds)
910            and mbn.is_a_number(upper_bounds)
911            and math.isfinite(lower_bounds)
912            and math.isfinite(upper_bounds)
913            and math.ceil(lower_bounds) > math.floor(upper_bounds)
914        ):
915            raise ValueError(
916                "ceil(lower_bound={})={}".format(lower_bounds, math.ceil(lower_bounds))
917                + " is greater than floor("
918                + "upper_bound={})={}".format(upper_bounds, math.floor(upper_bounds))
919                + " for variable set={}".format(name)
920            )
921        lower_bounds = _convert_to_series_and_validate_index(lower_bounds, index)
922        upper_bounds = _convert_to_series_and_validate_index(upper_bounds, index)
923        is_integrals = _convert_to_series_and_validate_index(is_integral, index)
924        return pd.Series(
925            index=index,
926            data=[
927                # pylint: disable=g-complex-comprehension
928                Variable(
929                    helper=self.__helper,
930                    name=f"{name}[{i}]",
931                    lb=lower_bounds[i],
932                    ub=upper_bounds[i],
933                    is_integral=is_integrals[i],
934                )
935                for i in index
936            ],
937        )

Creates a series of (scalar-valued) variables with the given name.

Arguments:
  • name (str): Required. The name of the variable set.
  • index (pd.Index): Required. The index to use for the variable set.
  • lower_bounds (Union[int, float, pd.Series]): Optional. A lower bound for variables in the set. If a pd.Series is passed in, it will be based on the corresponding values of the pd.Series. Defaults to -inf.
  • upper_bounds (Union[int, float, pd.Series]): Optional. An upper bound for variables in the set. If a pd.Series is passed in, it will be based on the corresponding values of the pd.Series. Defaults to +inf.
  • is_integral (bool, pd.Series): Optional. Indicates if the variable can only take integer values. If a pd.Series is passed in, it will be based on the corresponding values of the pd.Series. Defaults to False.
Returns:

pd.Series: The variable set indexed by its corresponding dimensions.

Raises:
  • TypeError: if the index is invalid (e.g. a DataFrame).
  • ValueError: if the name is not a valid identifier or already exists.
  • ValueError: if the lowerbound is greater than the upperbound.
  • ValueError: if the index of lower_bound, upper_bound, or is_integer
  • does not match the input index.

def add_linear_constraint( self, linear_expr: Union[ortools.linear_solver.python.model_builder.LinearExpr, int, float, numbers.Real, numpy.number], lb: Union[int, float, numbers.Real, numpy.number] = -inf, ub: Union[int, float, numbers.Real, numpy.number] = inf, name: Optional[str] = None) -> ortools.linear_solver.python.model_builder.LinearConstraint: 
1039    def add_linear_constraint(  # pytype: disable=annotation-type-mismatch  # numpy-scalars
1040        self,
1041        linear_expr: LinearExprT,
1042        lb: NumberT = -math.inf,
1043        ub: NumberT = math.inf,
1044        name: Optional[str] = None,
1045    ) -> LinearConstraint:
1046        """Adds the constraint: `lb <= linear_expr <= ub` with the given name."""
1047        ct = LinearConstraint(self.__helper)
1048        if name:
1049            self.__helper.set_constraint_name(ct.index, name)
1050        if mbn.is_a_number(linear_expr):
1051            self.__helper.set_constraint_lower_bound(ct.index, lb - linear_expr)
1052            self.__helper.set_constraint_upper_bound(ct.index, ub - linear_expr)
1053        elif isinstance(linear_expr, Variable):
1054            self.__helper.set_constraint_lower_bound(ct.index, lb)
1055            self.__helper.set_constraint_upper_bound(ct.index, ub)
1056            self.__helper.add_term_to_constraint(ct.index, linear_expr.index, 1.0)
1057        elif isinstance(linear_expr, LinearExpr):
1058            flat_expr = _as_flat_linear_expression(linear_expr)
1059            # pylint: disable=protected-access
1060            self.__helper.set_constraint_lower_bound(ct.index, lb - flat_expr._offset)
1061            self.__helper.set_constraint_upper_bound(ct.index, ub - flat_expr._offset)
1062            self.__helper.add_terms_to_constraint(
1063                ct.index, flat_expr._variable_indices, flat_expr._coefficients
1064            )
1065        else:
1066            raise TypeError(
1067                f"Not supported: ModelBuilder.add_linear_constraint({linear_expr})"
1068                f" with type {type(linear_expr)}"
1069            )
1070        return ct

Adds the constraint: lb <= linear_expr <= ub with the given name.

def add( self, ct: Union[ortools.linear_solver.python.model_builder._BoundedLinearExpr, bool, pandas.core.series.Series], name: Optional[str] = None) -> Union[ortools.linear_solver.python.model_builder.LinearConstraint, pandas.core.series.Series]: 
1072    def add(
1073        self, ct: Union[ConstraintT, pd.Series], name: Optional[str] = None
1074    ) -> Union[LinearConstraint, pd.Series]:
1075        """Adds a `BoundedLinearExpression` to the model.
1076
1077        Args:
1078          ct: A [`BoundedLinearExpression`](#boundedlinearexpression).
1079          name: An optional name.
1080
1081        Returns:
1082          An instance of the `Constraint` class.
1083
1084        Note that a special treatment is done when the argument does not contain any
1085        variable, and thus evaluates to True or False.
1086
1087        model.add(True) will create a constraint 0 <= empty sum <= 0
1088
1089        model.add(False) will create a constraint inf <= empty sum <= -inf
1090
1091        you can check the if a constraint is always false (lb=inf, ub=-inf) by
1092        calling LinearConstraint.is_always_false()
1093        """
1094        if isinstance(ct, _BoundedLinearExpr):
1095            return ct._add_linear_constraint(self.__helper, name)
1096        elif isinstance(ct, bool):
1097            return _add_linear_constraint_to_helper(ct, self.__helper, name)
1098        elif isinstance(ct, pd.Series):
1099            return pd.Series(
1100                index=ct.index,
1101                data=[
1102                    _add_linear_constraint_to_helper(
1103                        expr, self.__helper, f"{name}[{i}]"
1104                    )
1105                    for (i, expr) in zip(ct.index, ct)
1106                ],
1107            )
1108        else:
1109            raise TypeError("Not supported: ModelBuilder.Add(" + str(ct) + ")")

Adds a BoundedLinearExpression to the model.

Arguments:
  • ct: A BoundedLinearExpression.
  • name: An optional name.
Returns:

An instance of the Constraint class.

Note that a special treatment is done when the argument does not contain any variable, and thus evaluates to True or False.

model.add(True) will create a constraint 0 <= empty sum <= 0

model.add(False) will create a constraint inf <= empty sum <= -inf

you can check the if a constraint is always false (lb=inf, ub=-inf) by calling LinearConstraint.is_always_false()

num_constraints: int

def objective_expression(self) -> ortools.linear_solver.python.model_builder._LinearExpression: 
1150    def objective_expression(self) -> "_LinearExpression":
1151        return _as_flat_linear_expression(
1152            sum(
1153                variable * self.__helper.var_objective_coefficient(variable.index)
1154                for variable in self.get_variables()
1155                if self.__helper.var_objective_coefficient(variable.index) != 0.0
1156            )
1157            + self.__helper.objective_offset()
1158        )

class ModelSolver: 
1202class ModelSolver:
1203    """Main solver class.
1204
1205    The purpose of this class is to search for a solution to the model provided
1206    to the solve() method.
1207
1208    Once solve() is called, this class allows inspecting the solution found
1209    with the value() method, as well as general statistics about the solve
1210    procedure.
1211    """
1212
1213    def __init__(self, solver_name: str):
1214        self.__solve_helper: mbh.ModelSolverHelper = mbh.ModelSolverHelper(solver_name)
1215        self.log_callback: Optional[Callable[[str], None]] = None
1216
1217    def solver_is_supported(self) -> bool:
1218        """Checks whether the requested solver backend was found."""
1219        return self.__solve_helper.solver_is_supported()
1220
1221    # Solver backend and parameters.
1222    def set_time_limit_in_seconds(self, limit: NumberT) -> None:
1223        """Sets a time limit for the solve() call."""
1224        self.__solve_helper.set_time_limit_in_seconds(limit)
1225
1226    def set_solver_specific_parameters(self, parameters: str) -> None:
1227        """Sets parameters specific to the solver backend."""
1228        self.__solve_helper.set_solver_specific_parameters(parameters)
1229
1230    def enable_output(self, enabled: bool) -> None:
1231        """Controls the solver backend logs."""
1232        self.__solve_helper.enable_output(enabled)
1233
1234    def solve(self, model: ModelBuilder) -> SolveStatus:
1235        """Solves a problem and passes each solution to the callback if not null."""
1236        if self.log_callback is not None:
1237            self.__solve_helper.set_log_callback(self.log_callback)
1238        else:
1239            self.__solve_helper.clear_log_callback()
1240        self.__solve_helper.solve(model.helper)
1241        return SolveStatus(self.__solve_helper.status())
1242
1243    def stop_search(self):
1244        """Stops the current search asynchronously."""
1245        self.__solve_helper.interrupt_solve()
1246
1247    def value(self, expr: LinearExprT) -> np.double:
1248        """Returns the value of a linear expression after solve."""
1249        if not self.__solve_helper.has_solution():
1250            return pd.NA
1251        if mbn.is_a_number(expr):
1252            return expr
1253        elif isinstance(expr, Variable):
1254            return self.__solve_helper.var_value(expr.index)
1255        elif isinstance(expr, LinearExpr):
1256            flat_expr = _as_flat_linear_expression(expr)
1257            return self.__solve_helper.expression_value(
1258                flat_expr._variable_indices,
1259                flat_expr._coefficients,
1260                flat_expr._offset,
1261            )
1262        else:
1263            raise TypeError(f"Unknown expression {expr!r} of type {type(expr)}")
1264
1265    def values(self, variables: _IndexOrSeries) -> pd.Series:
1266        """Returns the values of the input variables.
1267
1268        If `variables` is a `pd.Index`, then the output will be indexed by the
1269        variables. If `variables` is a `pd.Series` indexed by the underlying
1270        dimensions, then the output will be indexed by the same underlying
1271        dimensions.
1272
1273        Args:
1274          variables (Union[pd.Index, pd.Series]): The set of variables from which to
1275            get the values.
1276
1277        Returns:
1278          pd.Series: The values of all variables in the set.
1279        """
1280        if not self.__solve_helper.has_solution():
1281            return _attribute_series(func=lambda v: pd.NA, values=variables)
1282        return _attribute_series(
1283            func=lambda v: self.__solve_helper.var_value(v.index),
1284            values=variables,
1285        )
1286
1287    def reduced_costs(self, variables: _IndexOrSeries) -> pd.Series:
1288        """Returns the reduced cost of the input variables.
1289
1290        If `variables` is a `pd.Index`, then the output will be indexed by the
1291        variables. If `variables` is a `pd.Series` indexed by the underlying
1292        dimensions, then the output will be indexed by the same underlying
1293        dimensions.
1294
1295        Args:
1296          variables (Union[pd.Index, pd.Series]): The set of variables from which to
1297            get the values.
1298
1299        Returns:
1300          pd.Series: The reduced cost of all variables in the set.
1301        """
1302        if not self.__solve_helper.has_solution():
1303            return _attribute_series(func=lambda v: pd.NA, values=variables)
1304        return _attribute_series(
1305            func=lambda v: self.__solve_helper.reduced_cost(v.index),
1306            values=variables,
1307        )
1308

Once solve() is called, this class allows inspecting the solution found with the value() method, as well as general statistics about the solve procedure.
